author: TEDx Talks
description: Depression is a common mental health condition that is accompanied not only by a lot of personal suffering, but also by social or interpersonal problems. Research has shown that people who have recovered from an episode of depression frequently experience relapse. In this talk answers to the following questions will be discussed: What are the mechanisms that explain this high risk of relapse? Do we develop psychological scars when we experience a depressive episode? What factors put us at risk for relapse? How to disrupt the recurrent rhythm of depression? Psychological interventions (Preventive Cognitive Therapy; PCT) have been developed, specifically tailored to meet the needs of individuals who are in partial remission or those fully remitted. The interventions target risk factors for relapse including stress sensitivity, dysfunctional (cognitive) beliefs, and positive emotion regulation.
